intro: Equilabium annuum, commonly known as the annual equilabium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in warm climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
